item.title: Jimmy Kimmel is the latest to be put on pause. How Trump is influencing the world of late-night TV
item.description: Emmys watchers could assume there's never been a better time in Hollywood to hold its most powerful to account, but Jimmy Kimmel's axing proves otherwise.

item.title: Roosters hand Victor Radley 10-match ban for bringing NRL club into disrepute
item.description: The Sydney Roosters suspend Victor Radley for 10 matches without pay following media revelations he allegedly requested an illegal substance from former teammate Brandon Smith.

item.title: Bindi Magic art exhibition opens in Alice Springs as organisation celebrates 25 years
item.description: For 25 years Bindi Mwerre Anthurre Artists has been helping people with a disability to communicate through creativity.

item.title: Ry Jacob Nairn charged with murder after body found in Northampton
item.description: Ry Jacob Nairn has faced Geraldton Magistrates Court over the death of a 69-year-old man in Northampton earlier this week.

item.title: Man charged with threatening to kill pro-Palestinian rally organiser Remah Naji
item.description: Queensland counter-terrorism detectives charge a man with making verbal threats via a carriage service to Remah Naji, a spokesperson for a Brisbane-based pro-Palestinian action group.

item.title: Gout Gout, Torrie Lewis miss finals in brilliant 200m semifinal displays at World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo
item.description: Gout Gout and Torrie Lewis have missed the final of the 200m, both running to a hugely respectable fourth place in their semifinals.

item.title: Police officer found not guilty of assault during shopping centre scuffle at Batemans Bay
item.description: A New South Wales police officer is found not guilty of using unreasonable force while removing three girls and a woman from a scuffle at a shopping centre.

item.title: All the latest financial news
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Trump says Jimmy Kimmel off-air for 'bad ratings' as Democrats slam regulator for 'bullying' US ABC
item.description: Prominent leaders in the Democratic Party are accusing the US's communications regulator of "bullying" a network to take the long-running late night show off air.

item.title: AI-generated minister addresses Albanian parliament for first time
item.description: The world's first AI government minister was appointed last week by Albania's prime minister to oversee decisions on public tenders and to ease voter concerns about corruption.

item.title: Independent advice spells out mammoth task ahead for government to reach 2035 target
item.description: Getting to even the bottom end of the government's 62 to 70 per cent emissions reduction target by 2035 will require drastic increases to solar and wind power capacity, electric vehicle take-up and an extension of the safeguard mechanism, according to the Climate Change Authority.

item.title: After deadly floods in Bali, its people want answers. Many are blaming overtourism
item.description: Unexpected and deadly flooding rocked Bali last week at a scale many had never experienced before. In the wake of this disaster, the search for answers has begun.

item.title: The climate conversation is stuck in a loop, but out in the world things are changing
item.description: We don't have to wait for moonshot technologies to reach our climate targets. Most of the solutions to the climate crisis are already around us.

item.title: First Guardian, Shield superannuation disasters expose deep flaws in Australia's $4.3 trillion retirement system
item.description: The failed First Guardian and Shield schemes have cost about 12,000 Australians more than $1 billion in retirement savings and exposed deep flaws in how Australia's $4.3 trillion superannuation sector is regulated.

item.title: Therapists, patients raise concerns over The Hobart Clinic closure with fears it could be 'dangerous' for some
item.description: For more than four decades, The Hobart Clinic has provided private mental health services to clients. Since the announcement of its October closure, clinic staff, therapists and patients have warned of the negative impact on those reliant on the service.

item.title: Gout Gout's understanding of patience shows World Athletics Championships performance in 200m semifinal won't be one off
item.description: Gout Gout's promise and progress are on full display at the 2025 World Athletics Championships. But by showing patience, he could get even better.

item.title: Home owners warned to consider 'liveability' of properties amid climate change impact warning
item.description: Property experts say a "dizzying" report forecasting the impacts of worsening climate conditions on Australian properties has sounded a clear warning for the sector.

item.title: Parents call for football club culture change after death of 21-year-old son
item.description: Steven Callanan had the world at his feet and loved footy like it was a religion. The talented player could bring together communities while he played, but after a night of partying he took his own life.

item.title: Drug checking services handed bitter pill as Queensland government rams through law changes
item.description: The Queensland government has been unrepentant in its tough stance on drugs, with Health Minister Tim Nicholls telling state parliament this week it doesn't "support drug dealers", writes Janelle Miles.

item.title: Carnival of Flowers visitors brace for wet weather while smelling the roses
item.description: Visitors flocking to Queensland's Darling Downs for the annual Carnival of Flowers in Toowoomba are advised to take an umbrella, with thunderstorms forecast for the region.

item.title: Man fined for dumping 'volatile' chemicals into gutter on suburban Adelaide street
item.description: An Adelaide man who emptied drums containing hazardous chemicals into a suburban gutter — causing nearby residents to experience headaches and nausea — has been fined thousands of dollars.

item.title: Surprise La Niña hints at another wet and stormy Australian summer
item.description: Australia's key drivers of weather variability are stacking up to produce another wet, severe-weather season, with an increased risk of flooding, thunderstorms and cyclones.

item.title: Riverina family grapples with daughter's devastating childhood dementia diagnosis
item.description: Rachel Anderson says she knew something was not right when her daughter Hannah began struggling to remember things she had just done.

item.title: ASX rises, Aus Post to resume US parcel deliveries sooner, and BoJ leaves rates unchanged — as it happened
item.description: The Australian share market gained, after Wall Street's S&P 500 hit a record high, and the Bank of Japan kept its policy rate steady at 0.5 per cent.

item.title: Mount Isa waits for '11th-hour' decision on financial support for copper smelter
item.description: Copper production is on the chopping block in outback Queensland, with mining giant Glencore about to decide on its future. What is the cost of losing a legacy industry?

item.title: Kitchen floor at Palmerston Regional Hospital ripped up, replaced following food safety failure
item.description: Large sections of flooring at the Northern Territory's newest, multi-million-dollar hospital are having to be ripped up and replaced after the facility failed food safety checks.

item.title: Miranda Tapsell and Gwilym Lee show it 'takes a village' to raise a child in Top End Bub
item.description: Miranda Tapsell and Gwilym Lee return to their characters from the hit movie, Top End Wedding, to take on parenthood in the TV series, Top End Bub.

item.title: Federal politics: Albanese seizes on Ley's climate slip up — as it happened
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has seized on remarks made by Opposition Leader Sussan Ley about Australia's climate targets.

item.title: AFL finals fever takes hold as fans line up to buy tickets offline
item.description: AFL fans fed up with the online ticketing system have opted to line up in person days in advance to secure their finals tickets.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Young members bring new life to the Rural Fire Service
item.description: Nearly a quarter of all western NSW Rural Fire Service volunteers are older than 70, but some younger recruits are urging others to follow in their footsteps.

item.title: How Hawthorn can upset Geelong as the Hawks meet the Cats in 2025 AFL preliminary final
item.description: With a plethora of options up forward, there's one issue the Hawks need to pay attention to out of their back half if they want to upset the Cats tonight.

item.title: Jess Hull falls into world championships 800m semifinal with Claudia Hollingsworth, Abbey Caldwell
item.description: Three Australian women progress to the world championship 800m semifinals for the first time. And while Claudia Hollingsworth and Abbey Caldwell did it the usual way, Jess Hull took the scenic route.

item.title: No live export ships coming for WA sheep amid high prices, looming ban
item.description: Market dynamics are stopping live export ships from coming to WA for the rest of the year, raising the prospect of an official end to the trade years before a legislated ban is enforced.

item.title: Queensland government commits $4.5 million for locust control as swarms intensify
item.description: As the native pest destroys crops and pasture across outback Queensland, graziers say authorities must move swiftly to tackle them.

item.title: Water Corporation says it got advice wrong on Port Hedland water supply
item.description: The state-owned utility says advice that Port Hedland does not have enough water available to support major development was given in error.

item.title: Gippsland farmer blocks AusNet maintenance workers from entering property
item.description: A Victorian farmer who has hosted transmission lines on his property for decades says he is sick of maintenance workers damaging his property.

item.title: Australian Submarine Agency lobbies Fremantle locals amid protest over AUKUS defence hub
item.description: A push to earn the public's trust over a defence hub south of Perth by the Australian Submarine Agency draws protesters and sceptical residents in Fremantle.

item.title: Oscar Piastri says McLaren has clarified team orders after controversy at F1 Italian Grand Prix
item.description: Formula 1 drivers' championship leader Oscar Piastri says McLaren has "had a lot of discussions" since the controversial ending to the Italian Grand Prix two weekends ago.

item.title: Warm currents bring tens of thousands of giant yellowfin tuna to NSW South Coast
item.description: Fishers are reporting an unprecedented number of yellowfin tuna travelling from the tropics to the NSW South Coast, causing "mayhem" and excitement.

item.title: Gardens of Stone State Conservation Area walks open path to incredible vistas
item.description: New South Wales National Parks and Wildlife staff have spent 18 months transforming eroded vehicle trails into rehabilitated walks, opening previously inaccessible viewpoints.

item.title: QCOAL's Cook Colliery coal mine in central Queensland to close half of operation
item.description: A third Queensland coal miner has confirmed job cuts as it prepares to close one of its underground mine sites, with the company also putting the blame on rising costs and state government royalties.

item.title: Rabbits cause 'devastating' damage to Junee cemetery in southern NSW
item.description: The Junee Shire Council says it is battling a rabbit problem, which forced a recent closure of the town's main cemetery for a week, including on Father's Day, for a baiting program.

item.title: Asbestos discovery further delays Willyama High School demolition
item.description: Nearly two years after a mould-infested high school was closed indefinitely, high-risk friable asbestos has caused further delays to its demolition.

item.title: RONA. weaves together country, colonialism and club music on new EP It's All Here
item.description: This Kaytetye producer has a fresh take on the space race that draws from First Nations knowledge and culture.

item.title: Green Gravity secures old coal mine shaft to test gravitational energy storage
item.description: A disused coal mine in Wollongong will be the first test site for a renewable energy company that lowers weights down old mine shafts to spin turbines and create electricity.

item.title: China urges Papua New Guinea not to exclude other countries after it signed 'Pukpuk' communique with Australia
item.description: China has urged Papua New Guinea not to sign any deal that might exclude or restrict third parties from cooperating with the Pacific nation, as Australia scrambles to clinch a landmark defence treaty.

item.title: Pat Cummins hints at Ashes strategy amid recovery from back injury with 'starting aim' of playing in all five Tests
item.description: As the men's Ashes approaches, the Australian captain reveals his hopes for taking part in the five-Test series against England as he steps up his injury recovery.

item.title: Cowboys prepare to make NRLW finals debut against Sharks in Townsville
item.description: As the Cowboys eye the path to premiership glory ahead of their sudden-death semifinal against the Sharks, they are also creating pathways off field for the next generation of NRLW stars.

item.title: Gout Gout receives praise from Noah Lyles at World Athletics Championships

item.description: A Townsville bus driver involved in a crash that killed three women in north Queensland last year pleads not guilty to dangerous driving causing death or grievous bodily harm.

item.title: Hakyung Lee, mother accused of killing children, had a 'disease of the mind', defence expert tells court
item.description: Hakyung Lee has been charged with murdering her children and has pleaded not guilty by reason of insanity after leaving their bodies in an Auckland storage facility.

item.description: Jailed bus driver Brett Button and the bus company that employed him have been added as defendants in a class action stemming from a crash that killed 10 people.

item.description: Cronulla suggests it will not niggle Canberra in Saturday night's semifinal, despite the Brisbane Broncos successfully getting under the Raiders' skin in their thrilling one-point win.

item.description: Living in a smaller space doesn't mean you can't have a lush garden. Here's how to rejuvenate your garden with some easy tips.

item.description: Justin Holbrook has started his tenure as Newcastle head coach, tasked with turning the struggling NRL side around.

item.description: A Broken Hill man has run to Newcastle to raise funds and awareness for a rare condition called as Angelman syndrome.

item.description: Potato mop-top virus is here to stay and its source is unlikely to ever be discovered, Biosecurity Tasmania has said.

item.description: It's been two days since three people died after a devastating Optus outage caused hundreds of emergency calls to fail, but information about the incident remains scarce.

item.title: Israel faces pressure over Gaza ahead of General Assembly as United Nations confronts its own identity crisis
item.description: The UN's role in areas beyond diplomacy, such as in humanitarian aid and refugees, cultural heritage, health, and climate, are all under assault from savage budget cuts.

item.title: Sussan Ley and the Coalition face a ticking time bomb
item.description: The opposition leader survived a bruising post-election fight that left conservatives seething and has been left with no natural allies.

item.title: Climate risks report paints grim picture, but expert on societal collapse explains giving up is not the answer
item.description: Lethal heat, mosquito-borne viruses, mass displacement and conflict — we got a glimpse into a grim climate future. Can imagining the end of the world be good for us, or is it a path to apathy?

item.title: The inside story of an ABC report that helped scuttle Australia's biggest foreign takeover
item.description: Secrecy around a major methane leak helped Santos avoid public scrutiny for years. It backfired after a prospective bidder reportedly found out via an ABC News report.

item.title: Senator calls for 'heads on spikes' to deter superannuation mismanagement
item.description: As questions mount about how Australia's retirement funds industry is regulated, a senator says regulator ASIC must more quickly and forcefully enforce the law.

item.title: How Jess Hull's 800m 'side quest' could see her stun at the 2025 World Athletics Championships
item.description: Jess Hull was concerned that a focus on the 800m was potentially hurting her endurance. Instead, her "side quest" could lead to a second world championship medal.

item.title: Investigation of eye-maker's online presence reveals multiple red flags
item.description: A reverse-image search of ocularist Jack McDonald's website shows that receptionist "Nadia" also appears on a dentistry blog and is known as "Donna" on a self-help guru's site. It's just one of the red flags that ABC NEWS Verify spotted during its investigation.

item.title: Technology is driving a quiet revolution in the way players relate to golf
item.description: Virtual golf venues are popping up en masse, as the sport adapts to suit the players of a new era.

item.title: Donald Trump's historic second state visit to the UK was filled with risks for Keir Starmer. Did it pay off?
item.description: Britain rolled the dice on an historic second state visit for the US president in a year of domestic and international political turmoil. It found out where its relationship with Washington was at.

item.title: Monash IVF pauses donor treatments in NSW as it conducts review of patient records
item.description: Patients have been left blindsided by Monash IVF's decision to temporarily halt treatments using donated eggs and sperm in New South Wales.

item.title: Collingwood and Brisbane meet again, two years on from classic 2023 grand final, for tantalising rematch
item.description: The 2023 grand final will go down as one of the best deciders in AFL history, and though the stakes are only marginally lower two years on, the numbers suggest Collingwood and Brisbane's 2025 preliminary final could be another classic.

item.title: Woman's snake bite death in Katherine sparks warnings against complacency
item.description: Experts say snake bite victims may not even be aware their lives are in imminent danger after a woman was killed by a snake in Katherine earlier this month.

item.title: Federal government's agriculture emissions reductions 'ambitious' but 'achievable'
item.description: A professor of carbon farming says the agriculture industry will "naturally" contribute to a 28 per cent emissions reduction projected by 2050, but is unlikely to hit its own net-zero targets.

item.title: Pink Floyd's album and ode to Syd Barrett Wish You Were Here turns 50
item.description: Pink Floyd looked to the past to find a way forward after the massive success of Dark Side Of The Moon in 1973. The result was Wish You Were Here, released 50 years ago this week.

item.title: Labor reshuffles its furniture as the Liberals try to save what’s left
item.description: Two resigning ministers, two major broken promises and an unfolding ecological crisis confront SA Labor six months out from a state election. Yet it's the Liberal Party staring down electoral punishment.

item.title: What time does the F1 Azerbaijan Grand Prix start? How can I watch it?
item.description: Oscar Piastri returns to the streets of Baku — one year on from a terrific victory — holding a 31-point lead in the Formula 1 drivers' championship.

item.title: Freezing rain or 12,000km away, these green Vikings will do anything for their beloved Canberra Raiders
item.description: Simon Tayoun's been a devout member of the Green Army since he watched his first-ever game of rugby league in 1987, and now he's become an unofficial mascot by bringing his custom drum to every game he can to lead the Viking Clap.

item.title: Perth family endure cold, wet winter in bus amid worsening housing crisis
item.description: A Perth man who has been sleeping rough in a bus with his family for the past three years wonders if he would be better off with a roof over his head and regular meals in jail.

item.title: Storm damage sees shark net installation delay at Sydney's Shark Beach in Nielsen Park
item.description: Shark Beach in Sydney's east is seasonally netted with an enclosure to protect swimmers from sharks during Sydney's warmer months — but for the upcoming school holidays, it is unlikely the nets will be installed in time.

item.description: The 700 voters living in the remote Central Darling Shire Council area of New South Wales will finally head to the polls to vote again.

item.title: Tasmania's tree fern trade accused of 'greenwashing' over native forest logging links, but others say it is sustainable
item.description: Thousands of native tree ferns are harvested from Tasmania's forests for export each year. Some say the trade saves ferns from destruction, while others accuse the industry of greenwashing.

item.title: Chelsea FC Women's star Sam Kerr presented with special football to mark 100 goals for club
item.description: Sam Kerr is honoured with a special football to mark her 100 goals for Chelsea — and she can't stop smiling since the landmark strike.

item.description: Victor Caulfield packed up his Australian home and moved to Italy, where he fell into the art scene as an accidental model.

item.title: South Australians reflect on life, 50 years after homosexuality was decriminalised
item.description: Since homosexuality was decriminalised in South Australia half a century ago, LGBTIQA+ people say the state has made strides, but there is still some way to go towards equality.

item.description: It’s easy to make these irresistibly sticky wings that will have you licking your fingers and reaching for more.

item.description: A controversial housing estate that would have been built on 26 hectares of Bundaberg's green space has been scrapped.

item.description: A changing of the guard in women's rugby union as two-time defending world champions New Zealand is beaten for the first time at the tournament since 2014 by a brilliant Canadian side.

item.description: Apiarists are concerned they are losing access to public land in Victoria that provides a critical food source for their hives.

item.title: Ten-year-old Amina was fetching water when a missile strike killed her

item.description: The celebrations were cut short soon after the finish when the team were disqualified for a faulty changeover.

item.title: Brazilian race walker Caio Bonfim loses wedding ring in race, wins maiden gold at World Athletics Championships
item.description: Brazilian race walker Caio Bonfim won a gold medal in the 20km race walk, the first major global title of his career. But he lost something important on the way.

item.title: F1 Azerbaijan qualifying: Oscar Piastri crashes out in Baku, Max Verstappen secures pole
item.description: Formula 1 drivers' championship leader Oscar Piastri crashed out of qualifying in Azerbaijan, but his teammate and championship rival Lando Norris was unable to make the Australian pay.

item.title: Republicans seize on Charlie Kirk's death to crack down on liberal dissent that puts freedom of speech 'in peril'
item.description: The Trump administration saw an opportunity to crack down on liberal groups in the wake of the death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. But not all conservatives are onboard.

item.title: What is 'Solastalgia' and how are climate-affected communities tackling it?
item.description: If you're overwhelmed by emissions targets, climate change and environmental collapse, start small and look to First Nations practices to help your wellbeing and the world around you.

item.title: Antinatalists say human suffering, and climate change, makes having children unethical. Are they right?
item.description: Elon Musk believes the collapsing birth rate is humanity's biggest danger. But antinatalists argue having kids is little more than a procreational Ponzi scheme, and the risks are real.

item.title: Asia's protests grew from social media where misinformation also spread
item.description: These movements may be separated by time, distance and language, but they were all born on social media, led by a new generation of activists fed up with the old systems of corruption and nepotism.

item.title: What makes China confident enough to ban microchips made by US firm Nvidia?
item.description: Beijing's decision this week to ban Chinese companies from using microchips made by US firm Nvidia indicates the country is increasingly confident about replacing them with domestically produced chips, experts say.

item.title: Pirate attacks and sea robberies surge in key South-East Asian shipping lane
item.description: Piracy and sea robberies are increasing in the strategic straits of Malacca and Singapore, which could have implications for Australian imports and exports.

item.title: Cyber attack on Collins Aerospace disrupts check-in systems at major European airports
item.description: The attack on a provider of check-in and boarding systems causes mass disruption at several major European airports, including London's Heathrow.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he will meet Donald Trump next week as Russia intensifies attacks
item.description: The Ukrainian president says he will hold "a meeting with the President of the United States" to discuss security guarantees for Ukraine and sanctions on Russia.

item.title: When is Jess Hull's 800m final? When do Nicola Olyslagers, Eleanor Patterson and Matt Denny compete?
item.description: Australia is looking at a veritable super Sunday on the final day of the 2025 World Athletics Championships, with four medals up for grabs. Here's when the Aussie contenders are in action.

item.title: Former nurse shares devastating experience of attempts to get urgent cancer surgery
item.description: Karenne Mosley was diagnosed with aggressive uterine cancer in March. She was booked in for surgery twice but is now in palliative care.

item.title: 'We should kill him': AI chatbot encourages Australian man to murder his father
item.description: Experts are calling for new regulations on artificial intelligence chatbots, after a triple j hack investigation uncovered a disturbing example of a chatbot encouraging a man to murder his father while engaging in paedophilic role-play.

item.title: Hard Quiz: So you think you're a trivia guru? Go on, prove it!
item.description: I like your trivia enthusiasm, but be careful — you're about to taste defeat.

item.title: The Duchess of Kent renounced her title in 2002 and never looked back
item.description: Away from the public eye, Katharine, the Duchess of Kent, was a trailblazer quietly changing lives.

item.title: When is Charlie Kirk's memorial service? How to watch it in Australia
item.description: A public memorial service will be held for the late political commentator at a stadium in the US state of Arizona.

item.title: Whale charity boss Brett Taylor allegedly ran euthanasia body 'discovery service'
item.description: Court documents allege a 53-year-old Queensland man ran a fake whale euthanasia charity to traffic assisted suicide drugs.

item.title: For Dr Mackenzie Little, javelin bronze at the World Athletics Championships is 'icing on the cake'
item.description: Mackenzie Little's second-successive World Athletics Championships bronze medal is an amazing achievement, all the more so considering she's a full-time surgical resident.

item.title: Chronic pain makes life hell for kids, but it's impacting work productivity as well
item.description: Chronic pain has devastating effects on those who suffer from it, including children, but it has wider impacts and they are costing Australia billions, a survey has found.

item.title: Jacinta Allan charts her own path with China in five-day tour of networking, photo ops and pandas
item.description: Premier Jacinta Allan has completed a tour of five Chinese cities where she has attempted to set the tone for future trade, boost Chinese international student numbers and promote her Suburban Rail Loop project.

item.title: Street artist Rone's new 90-metre mural a visual love letter to Geelong
item.description: The faces of 14 people will be immortalised in an enormous mural on the side of a new building in Geelong by locally born, globally renowned artist Rone.

item.title: How skateboarding became a family affair for Townsville single dad Jay MacAskill
item.description: For almost eight years, Jay MacAskill's skateboard was collecting dust at home — until his daughter found the skate park around the corner.

item.title: Jay MacAskill and his daughters — Skylah and Ava — are building a strong bond over a new found love of skateboarding.

item.title: Tough times in Wagga Wagga as young tennis stars chase grand slam dreams
item.description: Cara Korhonen played on Rod Laver Arena when she was 10 years of age and is putting her blood, sweat and tears into setting foot on there again.

item.title: Canadian teenage golfer Anna Huang leads the La Sella Open by three shots after 54 holes
item.description: Canadian golf sensation Anna Huang, 16, is on the brink of making history, holding a three-shot lead going into the final round of a Ladies European Tour event in Spain.

item.title: Addressing Australia's housing crisis is a mammoth task. Is making housing a human right the answer?
item.description: The ACT government has passed legislation enshrining housing as a human right. What does that mean, and should other states follow?

item.description: As Anthony Albanese touches down in New York ahead of the UN General Assembly, Republicans issue a warning against formally recognising Palestinian statehood.

item.title: SA Liberals' star candidate in spotlight after AI algal bloom 'admin error'
item.description: When Frank Pangallo announced he was joining the Liberal party, he vowed to put the blowtorch on a first-term government riding high in the polls. But barely four weeks later, the blowtorch is firmly on Pangallo instead, writes Leah MacLennan.

item.title: Women celebrate vintage glam, self-love and healthy body image with pin-up
item.description: Women are embracing modern pin-up culture as a way to express confidence and joy in their own skin.

item.title: Baby dies after ute hits Jeep on the Pacific Motorway at Gaven on the Gold Coast
item.description: Police say initial investigations indicate a silver Jeep was parked on the side of the northbound M1, near the Smith Street on ramp, when it was struck by a grey utility.

item.title: The Adelaide Crows have been the powerhouse of the AFLW. Now they are being challenged
item.description: The AFLW's rapid evolution has been a double-edged sword for Adelaide, which is the most successful club in competition history, having won three of the eight premierships.

item.title: Man formally charged with murdering TikTok influencer Sana Yousaf in Pakistan
item.description: A Pakistani court charges a 22-year-old man with murder for shooting a teenage social media influencer, Sana Yousaf, after refusing his offer of friendship.

item.title: Inside Ninga Mia, a forgotten community in the shadow of Kalgoorlie the city of gold
item.description: There's an eerie silence in Ninga Mia, a once thriving community on the edge of Kalgoorlie. The Aboriginal reserve is a microcosm of the cycle of displacement endured by many First Nations people.

item.title: Cockchafer worm wreaking havoc on West Australian grain crops
item.description: Growers and scientists have teamed up in a bid to combat the rapidly increasing population of the voracious pest, which is devastating crops in WA's south-east.

item.title: Government has not set 2035 renewables target, downplays 90 per cent
item.description: In New York for the UN summit, Energy Minister Chris Bowen declines to offer a renewable energy target for 2035 after the Climate Change Authority projected more than 90 per cent would be needed to hit its recommended emissions target.

item.title: Symbio Wildlife Park emu chicks being raised by hens after father walks out
item.description: Birds of a different feather are flocking together at a wildlife park in New South Wales, where the chickens have been given the responsibility of being foster parents to a pair of abandoned emu chicks.

item.title: White House says the new $100k H-1B visa fee won't apply to existing holders
item.description: The massive fee hike prompted a panicked reaction from big tech companies, but the US government says workers already on the visa won't be affected.

item.title: Koori Court marks 20 years in Mildura as Victoria approaches treaty
item.description: Mildura marks two decades since its Koori Court opened, as Victoria sees mixed results in the push to reduce Indigenous incarceration and offending rates.

item.title: UK fighter jets begin NATO air defence mission over Poland
item.description: British fighter jets fly their first NATO air defence unit over Poland as part of a mission to bolster the Western alliance's defences following a Russian drone incursion this month.

item.title: Crocodiles on the move in northern Australia as breeding season arrives
item.description: It's crocodile breeding season and at one central Queensland farm, the drama is on par with a reality television dating show as keepers try to work out the best pairings.

item.title: Optus outage 'unlikely' to have caused baby's death, police say, but impact spreads to NSW
item.description: Optus reveals that in addition to customers in South Australia, Western Australia and the Northern Territory, two people in New South Wales were unable to connect to emergency services during the 13-hour outage last Thursday.

item.title: Life on Aboriginal reserve remembered by Carnarvon traditional owners
item.description: In 1975, an anthropologist wrote his thesis on Carnarvon's rich Aboriginal reserve. Decades later, traditional owners revisit the work to contribute to "big truth-telling" documentary.

item.title: Australian-born singer drops out of Russian-hosted Intervision song contest after 'political pressure'
item.description: Vassy dropped out of the contest at the last minute after coming under what Russian organisers said was "unprecedented political pressure from the government of Australia".

item.title: How Brisbane, Hawthorn, Geelong and Collingwood stay on top of the AFL world
item.description: The 21st century has been dominated by four AFL clubs — Geelong, Hawthorn, Collingwood and Brisbane — but there's no single secret to their success.

item.title: Penola High School's agriculture program revives community and enrolments
item.description: Cory O'Connor's three-week teaching placement turned around his hometown high school. Now he's receiving an award for the agriculture program he started there.

item.title: Explaining Aussie driving culture to make roads safer for recent arrivals
item.description: Driving a car or riding a bike may be essential for temporary migrants studying or working in Australia, but hook turns, wombat crossings, and roundabouts can be unfamiliar territory. Here are some locals working to change that.

item.title: Pistachios are the latest food trend and a lot of work goes into predicting what's next
item.description: Pistachios have become the food flavour of the season, and a lot of work goes into predicting what the next big thing will be.

item.title: Cats star Tyson Stengle desperate to win second AFL premiership
item.description: Three years after Tyson Stengle capped off his remarkable AFL career resurrection with a premiership, the Geelong forward believes a second premiership would hold greater significance.

item.title: WA police investigate after man found with critical injuries dies on Kalgoorlie street
item.description: Detectives from the Major Crime Division are investigating the death near a popular park in the Goldfields city early on Sunday morning.

item.title: Optus failed to follow 'protocols' in not notifying police about outage sooner, WA deputy premier says
item.description: Optus failed to follow protocol after it only contacted WA Police late Thursday evening about an outage affecting triple-0 calls, Acting Premier Rita Saffioti says.

item.title: Penrith Panthers hammer Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs to keep NRL premiership five-peat hopes alive
item.description: Penrith has crushed Canterbury-Bankstown after a phenomenal first half to claim a 46-26 victory, keeping their hopes of a fifth-consecutive NRL premiership alive.

item.title: Demons defeat Eagles as Crows, Giants, Lions and Saints score AFLW wins
item.description: The Demons' Eden Zanker enjoys a day out with five goals to help defeat Daisy Pearce's young Eagles squad by 51 points, while the Crows launch a final-quarter fightback to get past the Suns.

item.title: How to clean out your wardrobe as the seasons change
item.description: It's the kind of task that can seem overwhelming, but the change of season is the perfect opportunity to review what's in your wardrobe.

item.title: World's top motocross riders travel to Darwin to compete in Australian MXGP finale
item.description: The MXGP championships have returned to Australia for the first time in more than two decades, with the world's best riders descending on Darwin to test their skills in a competition broadcast to more than 100 countries.

item.title: Penrith's win over Canterbury was a reminder there is no team like them
item.description: Canterbury is a team built in Penrith's image, but the Panthers served Canterbury a stark reminder that there can be only one.

item.title: Live updates: Jess Hull, Nicola Olyslagers, Eleanor Patterson in action at World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo Day nine
item.description: The final day of action at the 2025 World Athletics Championships gets underway, with what could be a super Sunday in store for Australian athletics. Follow live.

item.title: Multiple people hospitalised after bus and car crash on busy M2 in Sydney's north-west
item.description: A bus driver is among 11 people hospitalised after a bus and a car crash on the M2 at Macquarie Park in what emergency responders described as a "complex incident".

item.title: SA opposition promises to slash public transport fares to 50 cents, if elected next year
item.description: The SA opposition has promised to introduce 50 cent fares for all public transport, if elected in March next year.

item.title: Australia formally recognises state of Palestine as Anthony Albanese arrives in US
item.description: The historic decision foreshadowed last month has now become a reality, as Australia moves with Canada and the United Kingdom to join the growing list of countries to recognise Palestinian sovereignty.

item.title: Can recognising the state of Palestine achieve a two-state solution as Israel continues bombing Gaza?
item.description: While the Israel Defense Forces bomb Gaza and bulldoze the West Bank for settlements, moves to recognise Palestine in pursuit of a two-state solution may appear like something of a sick joke.
